intro: Randia nipponensis, commonly known as Japanese randia, is a flowering plant native to East Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, opposite leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pink, with four petals, and it produces small, fleshy berries. Randia nipponensis is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
